page.title: 07WYKEHAM _ FARMING Continued
page.content: SHEEP _approx: 550 Breeding Ewes are grazed producing 800_1000 lambs which are fattened and sold. Of the Breeding Ewes 50 are pure Suffolks from which Ram Lambs are produced for commercial use. Another 20 Ewes are the old Linc_ _olnshire Long Wools. All sheep are sheared and wool sold. A Lincolnshire fleece can weigh up to 23 lbs compared with 8_10 lbs for ordinary sheep. Wool is sent to Central Wool Growers. CATTLE _ More cattle kept in winter than in summer on permanent pasture of 80 acres. In winter 100 Beef Cattle kept in Crew Yard including pure Linc_ _olnshire Reds which are used for Bull Breeding, and of 5 Bulls sent from this country to Argentine recently one came from this farm.In summer 70 sent to more extensive grazing at Thorganby Estate and some cows with calves are kept at Wykeham.
